traits.name: Shapechanger
entries: The impersonator can use its action to polymorph into a Small or Medium humanoid it has seen, or back into its true form. Its statistics, other than its size, are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed. It reverts to its true form if it dies.

traits.name: Ambusher
entries: In the first round of a combat, the impersonator has advantage on attack rolls against any creature it {@quickref Surprise|PHB|3|0|surprised}.

traits.name: Surprise Attack
entries: If the impersonator surprises a creature and hits it with an attack during the first round of combat, the target takes an extra 10 ({@dice 3d6}) damage from the attack.

actions.name: Multiattack
entries: The impersonator makes two melee attacks.

actions.name: Slam
entries: Melee atk +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 7 (1d6 + 4 damage) bludgeoning damage.

actions.name: Read Thoughts
entries: The impersonator magically reads the surface thoughts of one creature within 60 feet of it. The effect can penetrate barriers, but 3 feet of wood or dirt, 2 feet of stone, 2 inches of metal, or a thin sheet of lead blocks it. While the target is in range, the impersonator can continue reading its thoughts, as long as the impersonator's {@status concentration} isn't broken (as if {@status concentration||concentrating} on a spell). While reading the target's mind, the impersonator has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Insight}) and Charisma ({@skill Deception}, {@skill Intimidation}, and {@skill Persuasion}) checks against the target.
